snippet: The police arrested Naoko Kikuchi, a former cult member who was wanted in the subway nerve-gas attack that killed 13 commuters and sickened 5,000 more.
abstract: Japanese police arrest Naoko Kikuchi, former Aum Shinrikyo cult member behind 1995 nerve-gas attack on Tokyo subway that killed 13 commuters and sickened 5,000 more; Kikuchi, who eluded the police for 17 years, is accused of manufacturing the sarin gas used in the attack.
lead_paragraph: The police arrested Naoko Kikuchi, a former cult member who was wanted in the subway nerve-gas attack that killed 13 commuters and sickened 5,000 more.

headline.seo: Japan Arrests Fugitive Wanted in 1995 Gas Attack
headline.main: Japan Arrests Fugitive Wanted in 1995 Gas Attack
headline.print_headline: Japan Arrests Fugitive Wanted In 1995 Tokyo Nerve Gas Attack
